name: rufflewing butterfly
sizes_available: one size only but it can be easily adjusted by using thicker yarn
notes:
learn how to crochet a beautiful butterfly with this free crochet pattern.
it is quick, easy, and perfect for beginners. 
using only basic stitches, you’ll create a lightweight butterfly appliqué that’s ideal for decorating accessories, garments, or home décor. 
this project is a fun way to use up yarn scraps and add a handmade touch to your next crochet project.

it works up super fast and it’s easy enough for an adventurous beginner as it has a full **step-by-step photo tutorial**, exclusively available on my blog [here][1].

you can also download a **print friendly version** (completely free) from my ravelry store.

also, there is a **full video tutorial** on my youtube channel, [here][2].

**special thanks to my testers:**
*cheryl freeman
becky hummel*

**difficulty:** 		advanced beginner

**finished size:** 			8 cm/ 3” on widest point

**materials needed:** 

•	3 mm (5/0) size hook 
•	***hobbii friends cotton 8/4*** in white (01) c1: 1 gram (4 metres/4.5 yards) 
•	***friends cotton 8/4 print*** in pastel rainbow (24) c2: 4 grams (13 metres/15 yards) 
•	yarn needle for weaving in ends
•	scissors
•	stitch markers *(optional)*

**us terms** used throughout.

**no chart/diagram available!**

i hope you’ll love it as much as i loved creating it!

***happy crocheting!***

*krisztina*
